transcript.sentence: The room is mostly dark, illuminated only by the glow of the tv and light filtering through the closed shutters.
Risk lip is an animated short.
It opens with a boy sitting on a couch and grossed in his video game. The tv screen is reflected in his eyes.
The boy's mom opens the front door and walks in, carrying a cardboard box.
She places the box on the table, blocking the boy's view.
He ducks to the side to continue playing his game.
The mom opens the blinds and the bois quints from the light flooding through the windows.
His mom heads upstairs.
The boy slowly opens the box in a yellow lab. Puppy bursts out.
The boy excitedly picks up the puppy,
but then notices it's missing half of its front left leg.
He is disgusted
and throws the puppy to the ground,
knocking the box off the table, and returns to his game.
The puppy orient himself and then runs back over to the boy,
propping himself upon the boy's leg to get his attention.
The boy kicks a puppy away and he tumbles back across the floor.
The puppy lands on his back and his regal ing around. When he notices a red ball under a cabinet across the room.
He runs for the ball and hits the cabinet head first.
The puppy shakes himself off and then dives under the cabinet to grab the ball.
He rolls the ball to the boy and waits expected lilly. The boy was intent on his game, but notices as a ball hits his shoe.
Irritated, the boy kicks the ball away. It rolls into the cardboard box.

Homer begins running around, bumping into things until he figures out how to get out.
The puppy escapes
box at the box a little, and then looks at the boy.
The boy laughs a little, realizes he's supposed to be disgusted, and goes back to playing his game.
The puppy runs across the room to where the red ball ended up,
grabs it and shakes it around in his mouth.
The boy watches the puppy play by himself
until the puppy notices the boy watching.

The boy smiles, resigned,
picks up the ball and puts it in his pocket.

They had outside to play fetch.
The clip ends with a view out the front door as the boy crutches out of the frame to play with his new puppy on the front lawn.
The name of the short, the present pops up on a blue screen, and credits begin to roll.
Director animation in screenplay by jacob frey.
Based on a comic strip by fabio cola.
Cast, quinn nealy, sam brown, producer anima, talks line producer jacob frye.
The name of the production company film academy is shown. And white light flashes against the dark background.
A boy's face appears, his eyes wide and mouth open.
The boy is sitting on the couch of his dark living room playing a video game. He rapidly press his buttons on his game controller, and his eyes are glued to the tv screen.
The boy's mother enters the house carrying a small cardboard box. She closes the door and walks towards the boy, smiling.
The lights duns the boy as he squint at the screen. But he continues with his game.
Now in the kitchen, the mom pointed the cardboard box, smiling.
She suddenly places the box on the table in front of the boy blocking his view of the screen. The boy jumps in surprise and moves to the left to see the screen.
He briefly glances down at the box, but focuses on his game.
Behind the boy, the mom lifts the window blinds to let sunlight in.
The boy looks at the box wondering what's inside. His mom answers the phone and walks upstairs.
The boy excitedly puts his game controller down. He places his hands on each side of the box, then slowly lifts the Top right flat.
Suddenly the box opens on its own, and a golden puppy emerges.
The boy eagerly picks up the dog and holds it close to his face while the dog wags its tail and kicks the air.
All of a sudden, the boy notices the dogs left part as a stump instead of a fully developed pa.
The boys disgusted by this Discovery and moves the dog far from his face.
He violently throws the dog on the ground to his right.
The dog lands on its back and looks up at the ceiling. Eyes widened. The boy angrily pushes the box off the table and resumed his video game.
The dog happily rolls into its stomach. It looks around, then uses its fully form, right? Potter set upon its hind leg.
The dog puts his right paw and the boys right leg to get his attention. But the boy kicks the dog as it rolls across the floor and falls on its face.
The boy scoffs at the dog with fur. A browse then looks back at the tv, shaking his head.
The dog falls on his back, seeing everything upside down. And notice is a small red ball underneath a nearby cabinet.
The dog turns right side up.
The dog runs toward the ball, but smashes into the cabinet because the space underneath is too small to enter.
The boy wiped his nose on his sleeve as he continues to play.

Angry. The boy kicks the ball away, but the dog thinks the boys playing, and it's face lights up in delight.
The ball inside the cardboard box, laying on its side on the ground.
The dog runs towards the ball, but it's dumb, causes it to trip and fall on its face.
The voice scoffs at the dog again and tries to resume his game, but keeps looking back at the dock.
The dog slowly pushes itself off the ground and tries to reach the ball in spite of its stump.
The dog finally lands inside the box, but the box lips over on Top of dog, trapping it inside.
The boy looks away from the screen, slightly concerned.
The box moves rapidly across the floor, bumping into things as the dog underneath tries to find its way out.
The boy chuckles and smiles at the dog, then stops shocked by his sudden warmth. He shakes off the feeling and once again looks irritated.
His anger, though, is slowly melting away. He looks down at the red ball, know next to the kitchen table as the dog runs toward it and puts it in his mouth.
The dog looks up at the boy and smiles. It picks up the ball in its mouth and persistently hops towards the boy tho tripling along the way.
Finally, the dog reaches the boy and drops the ball with boy's feet, wagging its tail and grinning.
The boy stares for awhile at the dog, softening to it with a look of remorse. A new found love for it. The dog sits and scratches his ear.

The boy is finally shown in full view. He puts the ball in his pocket and uses yellow forum crutches to walk towards the front door.
The boys left leg is missing as he like. The dog has a stump.
The dog follows the boy to the front door. The boy and locks the door and opens at a crack. And the dog uses its nose to further open the door.
The To make their way outside to the yard, the dog runs back and forth between the house and yard, playfully running under the boys missing leg.
The boy plays fetch with the eager dog, each maneuvering around the yard, despite their disabilities.
The film was written, directed and animated by jacob frey.

result.title: The Present - OFFICIAL
result.description:
Subtitles:
Basque, Bulgarian, Catalan, Chinese, Czech, Dutch, English, Estonian, Esperanto, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hebrew, Hungarian, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, Lithuanian, Polish, Portuguese, Russian, Slovak, Spanish, Turkish, Thai


“The Present” is a thesis short from the Institute of Animation, Visual Effects and Digital Postproduction at the Filmakademie Baden-Wuerttemberg in Ludwigsburg, Germany.

facebook page: www.facebook.com/thepresentshort
vimeo: https://vimeo.com/152985022

www.jacobfrey.de
www.mentirinhas.com.br

soundtrack by "Zealand"
itunes.apple.com/us/album/present-feat.-septemberkind/id915500091
https://www.amazon.de/gp/product/B00NDSJT6C?ie=UTF8&keywords=zealand%20the%20present&qid=1453999640&ref_=sr_1_2&s=dmusic&sr=1-2b-mp3-albums-bar-strip-0

We really hope you enjoy the result of our hard work. Thanks to everyone who help creating this film and everyone who supported us during the festivals. Thanks a lot for making this such an incredible journey.

“The Present” is based on a great little comic strip by the very talented Fabio Coala. Make sure to check out his page: mentirinhas.com.br

The Present screened on over 180 film festivals and won more than 50 awards world wide.

A more detailed list of all the festival awards:
01. Int. Festival of Animation Cinema and Comics Cartoon Club - Cartoon Kids Award
02. Flickers Rhode Island International Film Festival – Grand Prize Best Animation
03. FESA - Best Film for Children
04. Animago Award - Nominated for Best Short Film
05. Int. Student Film Festival Pisek – Special Jury Award 
06. Animalada - Best Short Animated Film 2014, Jury Award 
07. Anim Arte – Maxi Second place: Audience Award 
08. 15 Short Film Festival – Jury Award Best Animation 
09. PISAF – Audiences Prize (International) 
10. International Family Film Festival – Best Foreign Short Animation 
11. Enfoque, Int. Film Festival of Puerto Rico – Best Animation and Audience Choice Award 
12. Filmschau Baden Wuerttemberg – Best Animation
13. El Corto del Ano - Special Jury Mention 
14. Watersprite 2015 – Best Original Film Music 
15. California International Shorts Festival – Best Animated Short 
16. Short Tiger, Next Generation – Short Tiger Award
17. Landshuter Kurzfilmfestival – Audience Award Kids 
18. Soul 4 Reel Festival – Best Animation
19. Canada International Film Festival - Best Animation 
20. CMS Int. Children´s Film Festival – Special Mention

22. Sehsuechte Int. Student Festival Konrad Wolf – Best Children Film 
23. RiverRun International Film Festival – Best Student Animated Short 
24. VAFI – MIDI Section First Prize 
25. Newport Beach Film Festival – Outstanding Achievement in Filmmaking 
26. Timeline Film Festival – Filmmaker Award 
27. Animayo Festival de Cine de Animacion – Director Award 
28. Chile Monos Festival Internationcional de Animacion – Second Place Int. School Short Film Competition 
29. Carmarthen Bay Film Festival – Best Animation 
30. Int. Film Festival for Children & Youth - THE HERMÍNA TÝRLOVÁ AWARD FOR YOUNG ARTIST AGED UNDER 35 
31. Rendezvous Festival – Best Animation

37. Real to Reel International Film festival – Best Student Animation
38. Giffoni Film Festival – Second Most Voted Film

40. Ariano Film Festival – Best Animation
